DataElement.preferredName: Patient Prior First-Line Chemotherapy Administration Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria Code Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The coded response indicating whether a patient meets the criteria for enrolling onto a clinical trial with regards to first-line chemotherapy administration.

DataElementConcept.preferredName: Patient Prior First-Line Chemotherapy Administration Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary._Earlier in time or order._The preferred standard treatment for a particular condition._The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases._The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine._Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A person who requires medical care.

Concepts.definition: A person who receives medical attention, care, or treatment, or who is registered with medical professional or institution with the purpose to receive medical care when necessary.

Property.preferredName: Prior First-Line Therapy Chemotherapy Administration Clinical Trial Eligibility Criteria
Property.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:The preferred standard treatment for a particular condition.:The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.:The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.:Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

Concepts.definition: The preferred standard treatment for a particular condition.
The use of synthetic or naturally-occurring chemicals for the treatment of diseases.
The act of the dispensing, applying, or tendering of something to another, such as administration of a medicine.
Characteristics which are necessary to allow a subject to participate in a clinical study, as outlined in the study protocol. The concept covers inclusion and exclusion criteria.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: trial-specific criteria that a patient must meet to be enrolled.

ValueDomain.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: Indicator to represent a response of Yes, No, or Not Applicable._The affirmative response to a question or activity._The non-affirmative response to a question._Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context._A system of numbered categories for representation of data.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

Concepts.definition: Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

RepresentationTerm.preferredName: Yes No Not Applicable Code Indicator
RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question or activity.:The non-affirmative response to a question.:Determination that a value is not relevant in the current context.:A system of numbered categories for representation of data.:An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.
The non-affirmative response to a question.
Determination of a value is not relevant in the current context.
A symbol or combination of symbols which is assigned to the members of a collection.

An event, entity or condition that typically characterizes a prescribed environment or situation and determines or aids in determining whether certain stated circumstances exist or criteria are satisfied.

ValueDomain.changeDescription: Created to support Theradex design of CRFs for NCI CCR trials

ReferenceDocuments.name: Has patient received at least
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received at least one prior line of chemotherapy for ULMS (either in the adjuvant or metastatic setting)?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received one or more lines of chemotherapy and is not amenable to potentially curative radiotherapy or surgery?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 2
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received no more than 3 prior lines of therapy for metastatic disease?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 3
ReferenceDocuments.description: If patient has received prior adjuvant or neoadjuvant chemotherapy, was it completed more than 1 year prior to enrollment?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 4
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received more than 1 prior chemotherapy in the metastatic setting?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 5
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has patient received more than 1 line of chemotherapy for the treatment of localized pancreatic cancer?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 6
ReferenceDocuments.description: Has the patient had at least one prior line of cytotoxic chemotherapy?

ReferenceDocuments.name: Theradex - 7
ReferenceDocuments.description: Did patient receive prior first-line chemotherapy for this cancer and was it administered for at least 16 weeks without clinical, biochemical, or radiologic progression and there was at least a 2-week washout between first-line chemotherapy and start of therapy on clinical trial?
